text:
e="preserve">Oswaldo Cochrane Filho (29 July 1933 – 9 December 2020) was a Brazilian water polo player. He competed in the men's tournament at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He was born in Espirito Santo, Brazil. He played for the national team for the first time in 1955 until he retired after the the 1971 Pan American Games.
Cochrane Filho died on 9 December 2020 in Rio de Janeiro at the age of 87.
